settings.title: Itâ€™s as if we were never here...
settings.text: The essential concept at the heart of decent is to ensure we can unmake everything we make.

settings.content: The essential concept at the heart of decent packaging is to ensure we can unmake everything we make.
At Decent, we embrace community, collaboration, and communication. We want to stay informed and learn from others. This is a space for that.
If you'd like to use decent packaging at your cafe, restaurant, eatery or business, get in touch and one of our team will say hello, weâ€™d love to hear from you.
At decent packaging we want your brand to stand out. We pride ourselves on great design and a high quality product. We'll make sure your food and drink are walking out the door looking good!

settings.text: We are proud members of the Sustainable Business Network â€“ New Zealandâ€™s largest, longest-standing sustainable business organisation. We've been a finalist at the SBN Awards in 2017 & 2018.
We recently launched The Full Package, working together with We Compost to provide compost collection bins and a pickup service throughout Central Auckland. The first of it's kind.

settings.title: Sustainable packaging is just the start
PLA
settings.description: We use low-carbon PLA biopolymers made from renewable resources. PLA can break down fully, back into organic molecules.

settings.title: PAPER
settings.description: Paper is fantastic, but not all trees are grown equal! The Forest Stewardship Council ensures forests are responsibly grown, leaving positive environmental and social impacts. Decent only uses FSC or recycled paper, this paper can then be recycled again and again or composted too.

settings.title: Plant based and non toxic inks, dyes and glues
settings.description: Plant products know no bounds, all our inks are soy based and the adhesives we use are made from plants too. We also whiten paper products without bleach - using non toxic oxidation.

settings.title: CPLA
settings.description: The crystalised form of PLA; its heat tolerant cousin which maintains the same ability to compost fully but is opaque instead of clear, and a bit more hardy.

settings.title: Wheatstraw
settings.description:
Our straw range is leading the world in sustainability. 
Our factory purchases all of the waste straw from local farmers. It is then washed 3 times and turned into mulch before being moulded with a heat transfer into our plates, clamshells and bowls. The total process is chemical free, no bleach, chlorine or petroleum. Just wheat straw.

settings.title: Birchwood
settings.description: Our wooden range is FSC certified. The Forest Stewardship Council is an independent, not for profit, non-government organisation established to support environmentally appropriate, socially beneficial, and economically viable management of the worldâ€™s forests.

settings.title: Bamboo
settings.description: A strong and sturdy low impact plant. With the ability to grow upto 4cm an hour, It's one of the fastest growing plants on the planet, and with little to no impact on soil quality it's a beneficial resource.

settings.title: Bagasse
settings.description: Bagasse (Sugarcane) is the fibrous matter that remains after sugarcane stalks are crushed to extract their juice.

settings.title: Details
settings.description_preview: All Decent Packaging products are commercially compostable.
settings.description: Find out more information about the materials we use at Our Materials page.

settings.branding_btn_sub_text: We pride ourselves on good design and high quality products. Upload your design to see how we can make sure your products are walking out the door looking good.

settings.title: We can build anything
settings.description: The products of compost: Carbon, Hydrogen and Oxygen make up 99% of all organic molecules - the building blocks of all life. Will your salad container be repurposed into cos lettuce? Forget the rigidity of classic recycling, composting is part of the infinite, circular, cycle of natural life.

settings.title: Decomposes within 12 weeks
settings.description: All of our products are commercially compostable. This is because in commercial facilities we can guarantee at least 60 degree heat and therefore swift decomposition within 12 weeks.

settings.title: Plastic recycling is broken
settings.description: The most viable solution for single-use disposable packaging is a full cycle, organic recycling solution. Plant-based packaging waste can integrate into the organic waste system and be utilised as compost for the next generation of plants.

settings.content: Decent Packaging is an innovative packaging company striving to revolutionise the packaging industry by leading the way with sustainably produced products, an unbeatable level of customer service and committed product stewardship.

settings.title: Youâ€™re in good company

settings.title: We're here to help
settings.description: Get in touch, once youâ€™ve spoken to one of our team, we can then supply you with everything you need to get the ball rolling.

settings.title: Choose your product
settings.description: From Coffee Cups to Napkins, we can personalise most products from our packaging range, and we have the ability to produce other products too. If you've got an idea - we'd love to help make it a reality.

settings.title: Weâ€™re with you every step of the way
settings.description: We simplify the process by working with you, from the design stage â€“ right through to logistics, storage, and delivery.

settings.title: The Full Package
settings.text: Compostable packaging waste can integrate into the organic waste system producing nutrient rich fertiliser from the composting process. Weâ€™ve partnered with First Mile to collect and compost everything from decent cups and cutlery, to decent takeaway lunch boxes. The packaging is put into an autoclave which is similar to a very high temperature pressure cooker. This process expedites the breaking down of the compostable packaging materials, and then these materials go through the standard Anaerobic Digestion process (usually used for food), which produces fertiliser, and the methane produced during the decomposition process is burned to produce green energy.

settings.title: Carbon Zero
settings.text: We are proud to be a ToitÅ« carbonzeroCertTM certified organisation. This means we have completed three key steps. Through data analysis and helpful online tools, we measured the emissions from our organisation's activities - this includes everything from shipping our orders, to driving our delivery vans, even our flights to the UK so we could set up Decent Packaging. We then set targets to reduce our total emissions, along with our emissions per carton sold. We are a growing company, so proportional emissions are important, but we are shooting for a total reduction year-on-year, because if not now, when?... and if not us, who? For the third step, ToitÅ« Envirocare help us offset all of our unavoidable emissions through buying carbon credits in New Zealand and Asia - supporting forest growing projects and solar panel programs which are certified to capture carbon and therefore bring our net emissions down to zero!

For a long time, our economy has been â€˜linearâ€™. This means that raw materials are used to make a product, and after its use any waste (e.g. packaging) is disposed of in landfill or incinerated. Since 1964 plastic production has increased twenty-fold, yet just 5% of plastics are recycled effectively.

To transition to a circular economy means preventing waste in the first place by using by-products like bagasse. If new raw materials are needed, they must be obtained sustainably so that natural and human environments are not damaged.

settings.title: Our Collection  Partners
settings.text: We recommend using our Collection Partners, to achieve our goal of simplifying sustainability.

Made  from plants
settings.text: We are living in the future. The practical use of waste products, the ability to isolate starch molecules, and sustainable agriculture have transformed disposable food packaging into an industry beyond oil. Everything we make at decent packaging we can unmake; everything is simply made from plants. From production to disposal, plant products are kind to the environment; they fit in with the circle of natural life. Oil based plastic products are the opposite. Sourcing oil is dangerous - oil spills, super toxic refineries, and a long history of unethical business practice afflicts the fossil fuel industry. Globally, packaging needs to be better, and our contribution is making packaging from plants.

settings.title: â€œThe essential concept at the heart of decent packaging is to ensure we can unmake everything we make.â€
FSC grown or Recycled Paper
settings.description: Paper is fantastic, but not all trees are grown equal! The Forest Stewardship Council ensures forests are responsibly grown, leaving positive environmental and social impacts. We only use FSC or recycled paper, this paper can then be recycled again and again or composted too.

settings.title: Bagasse
settings.description: Officially the waste from sugarcane production, the result is a diverse and easily malleable plant material that we can mould into loads of fantastic products. Using only heat and water in production, these materials are super sustainable, perfect for hot and cold foods and certified home compostable.

settings.title: PLA (Poly Lactic Acid)
settings.description: PLA molecules are derived from corn, we use this rather than using plastic made from fossil fuels. We use low-carbon PLA biopolymers made from renewable resources. PLA can break down fully, back into organic molecules.

settings.title: CPLA (Crystalised form of PLA)
settings.description: This is PLA's heat tolerant cousin which maintains the same ability to compost fully but is opaque instead of clear, and a bit more hardy.

settings.title: Inks, Dyes & Glues
settings.description: We use plant based and non toxic inks, dyes and glues at decent packaging. Plant products know no bounds, all our inks are soy based and the adhesives we use are made from plants too. We also whiten paper products without bleach - using non toxic oxidation.

settings.title: ASTM D6400 Certification
settings.description: This is the international standard which uses tests to determine if bioplastics products will compost satisfactorily in commercial facilities.

settings.title: ASTM D6868 Certification
settings.description: This is the international standard which is used to determine if mixed material products which include bioplastic linings or films will compost satisfactorily in commercial facilities.

settings.title: DIN EN 13432 Certification
settings.description: This is the international standard which has criteria that gives acceptance of packaging recoverable through commercial composting.

settings.title: TÃœV Austria Belgium OK Compost Home composting Certification
settings.description: The TÃœV Austria Belgium OK Compost Home composting certification is an adaptation of EN 13432 which requires at least 90% degradation of the product in 12 months at an ambient 20-30 degrees celsius as expected in a home compost.

settings.text:
Distribution Bloom

At decent packaging, all of our decisionsÂ are driven by our main purpose; simplifying sustainability for our customers. We're beyond proud to share our partnership with Felix and the team at Distribution Bloom, our new local supplier of decent packaging to Canada.

Montreal based company Distribution Bloom was an obvious choice for us, they align with our business values and represent many other brilliant ethical and sustainable brands. They deliver across the province directly, in 24 hours with no minimums.

Get in touch: hello@distributionbloom.com

settings.quote: We have developed a brilliant partnership with the decent packaging team, whoâ€™ve provided ample support throughout the process of introducing a new 100% home compostable coffee bag for us. Alongside this, they have helped us for a few years now with our branded takeaway hot cups and takeaway packaging solutions for our cafes. Their attention to detail and creative input has been and continues to be, greatly appreciated.
settings.author: Luke - Origin Coffee

settings.quote:
As we have evolved, decent has supported us with our packaging, developing great custom branding that really resonates with our customers and makes our brand stand out. We absolutely love having a permanent Full Package compost bin outside our Broadway Market cafe, helping our customers close the composting loop. decent were extremely helpful in getting this set up.

We love the fact that they are an ongoing sponsor for the London Coffee Festival to help ensure the event is waste-free for the entire coffee industry.
settings.author: Joel - Climpson & Sons

settings.quote:
Weâ€™ve been working with decent packaging at both our sites for a good few years now. We really value the personable service from our account managers and the forward-thinking when it comes to all things packaging. decent fully align with our business ethos - as recently accredited with our B-Corp certification at Ozone Coffee Roasters, itâ€™s important we are working with like-minded suppliers.Â 

decent did all the leg work in setting up â€˜full packageâ€™ compostable recycling bins for our Ozone-branded takeaway cups, which has been extremely well received by our local communities and staff.
settings.author: Robyn - Ozone

settings.title: See why people love decent packaging
